channel.title: 508 help me with run.bat
channel.description:
Hello I have a problem with my run.bat This is my run.bat
@echo off cd ../bin color 40 "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" Bulby/Server 43594 PAUSE
And if i run you will see this... [IMG]http://img504.imageshack.us/img504/592/erroorrrrrr.png[/img]
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Bulby/Server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Bulby.Server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: Bulby/Server. Program will exit. Druk op een toets om door te gaan. . .
I hope anyone can help me

item.title: 508 help me with run.bat
item.dc:creator: @unc4ll3d unc4ll3d
item.description:
@unc4ll3d wrote:

justinxg27:

Run the compiler called Rs2; This might be in a different folder, depends, what server are you using?

i am using Mezzy-Scape 508 Source V3.5, but i really dont think the problem is with compiling, if u think so… where to find rs2 compiler? if u ve a other server for me to use i can download if u give me a link… i had tried everything 476 and 503 and 508 but all the same problem… only 317 and 562 servers work for me… but with 562 i walk althrough the walls :S ??? 317 is very normal… only i will 508…
i cant find rs2 compiler in no one of all the servers i ve :SS

Read full topic

item.title: 508 help me with run.bat
item.dc:creator: @unc4ll3d unc4ll3d
item.description:
@unc4ll3d wrote:

Davidi2:

Did you rename any of your folders? Did you move any folders around?

no i didnt do anything… only compile and then run…
compile would work but run not…
i had the same problem with 317 but i had debugged it…
i tried the same what i did by 317 with 508 but it didnt work…
so i deleted the server and client and downloaded it again… now the server is how i got it first :P…
i dont know what problem should be… i think i ve the classpath and path not right written…
this is what is written in my classpath and path… with pictures…

classpath

classpath C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_19\bin [URL=http://img210.imageshack.us/i/classpath.png/][IMG]http://img210.imageshack.us/img210/6145/classpath.png[/img][/URL]

Path

PATH C:\Windows\System32\;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_19\bin\; [URL=http://img535.imageshack.us/i/path.png/][IMG]http://img535.imageshack.us/img535/3117/path.png[/img][/URL]

Read full topic

item.description:
@unc4ll3d wrote:

[quote=“MoparScaperDude, post:2, topic:337115”]Add your classpath and then in the batch file, add:

[code]

  • cp.[/code][/quote]

i ve already the classpath, this is written in my classpath

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin

But what do u mean with batch? i cant see anything called batch :S
Do u mean path?
